original: ERNBERG, Victor Eduard Thorgny, Jur kand, Sekreterare, Sundsvall, f Degerfors 7/8 00 av disp V F E o Eleonora Taube, gm Svea Andersson. Studex Umeå 19, jur kand Upps 27. Tjg Nordmarks domsaga 27—30, Svea hovr o arméförvaltn 30, anst Skönviks AB 30, sekr Sundsvallsbolagens Gemens Förvaltn AB (Cellulosakoncernen) sed. 39. Kommunalflm Skön 35—38, led polisnmd 36—38.ERNBERG, Victor Fredrik, Disponent, Nordmaling, f Kkrona 9/10 75 av konsul V I Peterson o Doris Christansen, gm grev:an Eleonora Taube. Studex Sthlm 95, e jägniäst 99. Skogsförvalt Sandviks Ångsågs AB 99—12, flottn.ch Sävarälven 05—12, disp Nordmaling» Ångsågs AB o Olofsfors Br sed. 12. Ag villa-fastigh S Ängby. Ordf skogv.styr Västerb l, ordf komm.st, komm.flm, led sk.styr, kyrko-flm, kyrkoråd, sjukhusstyr, skogsv.styr :s förtroenderåd, insp komm mellansk; styr.ordf Sv Hdlsbkns Nordmalingskont, styr.led Nord-mal Ångsågs AB, ordf Umeå flottn.frn, styr.led Umeå tumn.frn o örnsköldsviks & Umeå Träv.exp.frn. Stud.res Norge, Finl, Tyskl, Ung. Av trycket: Upps i skogsv.tidskr. RNO, RVO, PatrstGM; Frimurare (X), Rotary.
translated:
ERNBERG, Victor Eduard Thorgny, Juris Doctor, Secretary, Sundsvall, born in Degerfors on August 7, 1900, to parents Victor Fredrik Eduard and Eleonora Taube, married to Svea Andersson. Completed high school exams in Umeå in 1919, obtained Juris Doctor degree in Uppsala in 1927. Served in the Nordmarks district court from 1927 to 1930, then joined the Svea Court of Appeal and the Army Administration in 1930. Employed by Skönviks AB from 1930, and as a secretary for Sundsvallsbolagens Gemens Förvaltnings AB (Cellulose Corporation) since 1939. Active in local politics in Skön from 1935 to 1938, served on the police board from 1936 to 1938.

ERNBERG, Victor Fredrik, Manager, Nordmaling, born in Karlskrona on October 9, 1875, to consul V I Peterson and Doris Christansen, married to Countess Eleonora Taube. Completed high school exams in Stockholm in 1895, enrolled in military service in 1899. Worked in forest management at Sandviks Ångsågs AB from 1899 to 1912, served as a log driving supervisor on the Sävarälven river from 1905 to 1912, and as a manager for Nordmaling Ångsågs AB and Olofsfors Bridge since 1912. Owned a villa property in S Ängby. Chairman of the forestry board in Västerbotten county, chairman of the municipal committee, municipal council, school board, church council, hospital board, forestry association's trust council, inspector of the municipal intermediate board. Chairman of the Nordmalingskont branch of the Swedish Trade Organization, board member of Nordmaling Ångsågs AB, chairman of the Umeå log driving association, board member of Umeå sawmill association and Örnsköldsvik & Umeå Timber Export Association. Studied abroad in Norway, Finland, Germany, Hungary. Recognized as RNO (Knight of the Order of the Northern Star), RVO (Knight of the Order of Vasa), recipient of Patriotic Society Grand Medal; Freemason (X), Rotary member.

career.workplace: Svea Court of Appeal and Army Administration
